title: What technology is used in telephone exchanges for switching voice calls nowadays? - Quora

response.answer_text: In most countries and telephone exchanges, it's still digital call switching that switches  most of the calls.  Many telcos are transitioning to NGN voice,  and that means that VoIP is used, and routers do the switching work.  In turn, that means that the main observable change when you enter a central office is that much less space is needed, compared with the old digital switching, as the outward appearance is very similar.
Like every other data center - racks of servers, routers and cables.  It's all just moving bits from one place to another, voice bits are no different than other bits.
